text:
The default value of 4096 is always specified fro event IDs logged using
NTEventLogAppender.  It'd be nice to have a mechanism that it supports for
specifying different event ids to be logged.
creator: jonathan.russell@gmail.com

text:
Created attachment 12894
Patch to add custom event id logging
creator: jonathan.russell@gmail.com
jonathan.russell@gmail.com
text:
I've gone ahead and created a patch.  The implementation should be backwards
compatible with existing deployments using NTEventLogAppender.  In order to get
the custom event id behavior the appender needs to be configured.

 o default event id can be configured (default = 4096)
 o custom event id parsing can be turned on and off (default = off)
 o if enabled, the event id is parsed from the msg passed to logger
    -the format is assumed to be assumed to be: "{#}{delimiter}{message}"
    -the delimiter is configurable (default = "|")
 o the implementation supports event ids 1-505 & 4096

Just updating the summary to indicate this item has a patch applied.

Thanks Jonathan.
creator: psmith@apache.org
